text: STANDARDS AND CONFORMITY ASSESSMENT
label: TITLE

text: Excerpt from 2010 Country Commercial Guide
label: BODY

text: Doing Business in Greece: 2010 Country Commercial Guide for U.S. Companies
label: HH1

text: Overview
label: HH1

text: Products tested and certified in the United States to American standards are likely to have to be
label: BODY

text: retested and re-certified to E.U. requirements as a result of the E.U.’s different approach to the
label: BODY

text: protection of the health and safety of consumers and the environment. Where products are not
label: BODY

text: regulated by specific E.U. technical legislation, they are always subject to the E.U.’s General
label: BODY

text: Product Safety Directive as well as to possible additional national requirements.
label: BODY

text: European Union standards created under the New Approach are harmonized across the 27
label: BODY

text: E.U. Member States and European Economic Area countries to allow for the free flow of goods.
label: BODY

text: A feature of the New Approach is CE marking. For a list of new approach legislation, go to
label: BODY

text: http://ec.europa.eu/enterprise/policies/european-standards/documents/harmonised-standards-
label: BODY

text: legislation/list-references/index_en.htm
label: BODY

text: While harmonization of E.U. legislation can facilitate access to the E.U. Single Market,
label: BODY

text: manufacturers should be aware that regulations and technical standards might also function as
label: BODY

text: barriers to trade if U.S. standards are different from those of the European Union.
label: BODY

text: Agricultural Standards
label: BODY

text: The establishment of harmonized E.U. rules and standards in the food sector has been ongoing
label: BODY

text: for several decades, but it took until January 2002 for the publication of a general food law
label: BODY

text: establishing the general principles of E.U. food law. This Regulation introduced mandatory
label: BODY

text: traceability throughout the feed and food chain as of Jan 1, 2005. For specific information on
label: BODY

text: agricultural standards, please refer to the Foreign Agricultural Service’s website at:
label: BODY

text: http://www.fas.usda.gov/posthome/useu/
label: BODY

text: There are also export guides to import regulations and standards available on the Foreign
label: BODY

text: Agricultural Service’s website: http://www.fas.usda.gov/posthome/useu/
label: BODY

text: Standards Organizations
label: HH1

text: The Hellenic Organization for Standardization is ELOT, which elaborates the Hellenic National
label: BODY

text: Standards, maintains a central point for testing of materials assesses management systems and
label: BODY

text: certifies products and services. Offices and laboratories of ELOT are located in Athens and
label: BODY

text: Thessaloniki.
label: BODY

text: The majority of imported products require the approval of ELOT, thus major end users request
label: BODY

text: all certificates, such as UCL, and TUV, in addition to those for fire, environmental and health
label: BODY

text: protection, from ELOT. ELOT also accepts appraisal certificates issued by one of the E.U.
label: BODY

text: recognized agencies.
label: BODY

text: STANDARDS AND CONFORMITY ASSESSMENT
label: HH1

text: Excerpt from 2010 Country Commercial Guide
label: BODY

text: E.U. standards setting is a process based on consensus initiated by industry or mandated by
label: BODY

text: the European Commission and carried out by independent standards bodies, acting at the
label: BODY

text: national, European or international level. There is strong encouragement for non-governmental
label: BODY

text: organizations, such as environmental and consumer groups, to actively participate in European
label: BODY

text: standardization.
label: BODY

text: Many standards in the E.U. are adopted from international standards bodies such as the
label: BODY

text: International Standards Organization (ISO). The drafting of specific E.U. standards is handled
label: BODY

text: by three European standards organizations:
label: BODY

text: CENELEC, European Committee for Electrotechnical Standardization
label: BODY

text: (http://www.cenelec.eu/Cenelec/Homepage.htm)
label: BODY

text: TSI, European Telecommunications Standards Institute (http://www.etsi.org/)
label: BODY

text: CEN, European Committee for Standardization, handling all other standards
label: BODY

text: (http://www.cen.eu/cenorm/homepage.htm)
label: BODY

text: Standards are created or modified by experts in Technical Committees or Working Groups. The
label: BODY

text: members of CEN and CENELEC are the national standards bodies of the Member States,
label: BODY

text: which have "mirror committees" that monitor and participate in ongoing European
label: BODY

text: standardization. CEN and CENELEC standards are sold by the individual Member States
label: BODY

text: standards bodies. ETSI is different in that it allows direct participation in its technical committees
label: BODY

text: from non-E.U. companies that have interests in Europe and gives away its individual standards
label: BODY

text: at no charge on its website. In addition to the three standards developing organizations, the
label: BODY

text: European Commission plays an important role in standardization through its funding of the
label: BODY

text: participation in the standardization process of small- and medium-sized companies and non-
label: BODY

text: governmental organizations, such as environmental and consumer groups. The Commission
label: BODY

text: also provides money to the standards bodies when it mandates standards development to the
label: BODY

text: European Standards Organization for harmonized standards that will be linked to E.U. technical
label: BODY

text: legislation. Mandates can be checked on line at
label: BODY

text: http://ec.europa.eu/enterprise/policies/european-standards/standardisation-
label: BODY

text: requests/index_en.htm
label: BODY

text: Due to the E.U.’s vigorous promotion of its regulatory and standards system as well as its
label: BODY

text: generous funding for its development, the E.U.’s standards regime is wide and deep - extending
label: BODY

text: well beyond the E.U.’s political borders to include affiliate members (countries which are hopeful
label: BODY

text: of becoming full members in the future) such as Albania, Croatia, FYR of Macedonia, and
label: BODY

text: Turkey among others. Another category, called "partner standardization body" includes the
label: BODY

text: standards organization of Australia, which is not likely to become a CEN member or affiliate for
label: BODY

text: political or geographical reasons. Many other countries are targets of the E.U.’s extensive
label: BODY

text: technical assistance program, which is aimed at exporting E.U. standards and technical
label: BODY

text: Regulations to developing countries, especially in the Mediterranean and Balkan countries,
label: BODY

text: Africa, as well as programs for China and Latin America.
label: BODY

text: INTE NATIONAL COPYRIGHT, U.S. & FOREIGN COMMERCIAL SERVICE AND U.S. DEPARTMENT OF STATE, 2008.
label: BODY

text: STANDARDS AND CONFORMITY ASSESSMENT
label: HH1

text: Excerpt from 2010 Country Commercial Guide
label: BODY

text: To know what CEN and CENELEC have in the pipeline for future standardization, it is best to
label: BODY

text: visit their websites. CEN’s "sectors" page provides an overview by sector and/or technical
label: BODY

text: committee whereas CENELEC offers the possibility to search its database. ETSI’s portal
label: BODY

text: (http://portal.etsi.org/Portal_Common/home.asp) leads to ongoing activities.
label: BODY

text: With the need to adapt more quickly to market needs, European standards organizations have
label: BODY

text: been looking for "new deliverables" which are standard-like products delivered in a shorter
label: BODY

text: timeframe. While few of these "new deliverables" have been linked to E.U. Regulations,
label: BODY

text: expectations are that they will eventually serve as the basis for E.U.-wide standards.
label: BODY

text: Key Link: http://www.cen.eu/cenorm/products/cwa/index.asp
label: BODY

text: Conformity Assessment
label: HH1

text: Conformity Assessment is a mandatory step for the manufacturer in the process of complying
label: BODY

text: with specific E.U. legislation. The purpose of conformity assessment is to ensure consistency of
label: BODY

text: compliance during all stages of the production process to facilitate acceptance of the final
label: BODY

text: product. E.U. product legislation gives manufacturers some choice with regard to conformity
label: BODY

text: assessment, depending on the level of risk involved in the use of their product. These range
label: BODY

text: from self-certification, type examination and production quality control system, to full quality
label: BODY

text: assurance system. You can find conformity assessment bodies in individual Member State
label: BODY

text: country in this list by the European Commission.
label: BODY

text: Key Link: http://ec.europa.eu/enterprise/newapproach/nando/
label: BODY

text: To promote market acceptance of the final product, there are a number of voluntary conformity
label: BODY

text: assessment programs. CEN’s certification systems are the Keymark, the CENCER mark, and
label: BODY

text: CEN workshop agreements (CWA) Certification Rules. CENELEC has its own initiative. ETSI
label: BODY

text: does not offer conformity assessment services.
label: BODY

text: Product Certification
label: HH1

text: To sell products on the E.U. market of 27 Member States as well as Norway, Liechtenstein and
label: BODY

text: Iceland, U.S. exporters are required to apply CE marking whenever their product is covered by
label: BODY

text: specific product legislation. CE marking product legislation offers manufacturers a number of
label: BODY

text: choices and requires decisions to determine which safety/health concerns need to be
label: BODY

text: addressed, which conformity assessment module is best suited to the manufacturing process,
label: BODY

text: and whether or not to use E.U.-wide harmonized standards. There is no easy way for U.S.
label: BODY

text: exporters to understand and go through the process of CE marking, but hopefully this section
label: BODY

text: provides some background and clarification.
label: BODY

text: INTE NATIONAL COPYRIGHT, U.S. & FOREIGN COMMERCIAL SERVICE AND U.S. DEPARTMENT OF STATE, 2008.
label: BODY

text: STANDARDS AND CONFORMITY ASSESSMENT
label: HH1

text: Excerpt from 2010 Country Commercial Guide
label: BODY

text: Products manufactured to standards adopted by CEN, CENELEC and ETSI, and published in
label: BODY

text: the Official Journal as harmonized standards, are presumed to conform to the requirements of
label: BODY

text: E.U. Directives. The manufacturer then applies the CE marking and issues a declaration of
label: BODY

text: conformity. With these, the product will be allowed to circulate freely within the E.U. A
label: BODY

text: manufacturer can choose not to use the harmonized E.U. standards, but then must demonstrate
label: BODY

text: that the product meets the essential safety and performance requirements. Trade barriers occur
label: BODY

text: when design, rather than performance, standards are developed by the relevant European
label: BODY

text: standardization organization, and when U.S. companies do not have access to the
label: BODY

text: standardization process through a European presence.
label: BODY

text: The CE marking addresses itself primarily to the national control authorities of the Member
label: BODY

text: States, and its use simplifies the task of essential market surveillance of regulated products.
label: BODY

text: Although CE marking is intended primarily for inspection purposes by Member State inspectors,
label: BODY

text: the consumer may well perceive it as a quality mark.
label: BODY

text: The CE marking is not intended to include detailed technical information on the product, but
label: BODY

text: there must be enough information to enable the inspector to trace the product back to the
label: BODY

text: manufacturer or the authorized representative established in the E.U. This detailed information
label: BODY

text: should not appear next to the CE marking, but rather on the declaration of conformity (which the
label: BODY

text: manufacturer or authorized agent must be able to provide at any time, together with the
label: BODY

text: product's technical file), or the documents accompanying the product.
label: BODY

text: Accreditation
label: HH1

text: Independent certification bodies, known as notified bodies, have been officially accredited by
label: BODY

text: competent national authorities to test and certify to E.U. requirements. However, under U.S.-
label: BODY

text: E.U. Mutual Recognition Agreements (MRAs), notified bodies based in the United States and
label: BODY

text: referred to as conformity assessment bodies, are allowed to test in the United States to E.U.
label: BODY

text: specifications, and vice versa. The costs are significantly lower which results in U.S. products
label: BODY

text: becoming more competitive. At this time, the U.S.-E.U. MRAs cover the following sectors: EMC
label: BODY

text: (in force), RTTE (in force), medical devices (in transition), pharmaceutical (on hold), recreational
label: BODY

text: craft (in force) and marine equipment (in force). The U.S. Department of Commerce, National
label: BODY

text: Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), has a link on its website to American and
label: BODY

text: European Conformity Assessment bodies operating under a mutual recognition agreement.
label: BODY

text: Key Link: http://ts.nist.gov/Standards/Global/mra.cfm
label: BODY

text: Accreditation is handled at Member State level. "European Accreditation" (http://www.european-
label: BODY

text: accreditation.org/content/home/home.htm) is an organization representing nationally recognized
label: BODY

text: accreditation bodies. Membership is open to nationally recognized accreditation bodies in
label: BODY

text: countries in the European geographical area that can demonstrate that they operate an
label: BODY

text: accreditation system compatible with EN45003 or ISO/IEC Guide 58.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: Publication of Technical Regulations
label: HH1

text: The Official Journal is the official gazette of the European Union. It is published daily on the
label: BODY

text: internet and consists of two series covering draft and adopted legislation as well as case law,
label: BODY

text: studies by committees, and more (http://eur-lex.europa.eu/JOIndex.do). It lists the standards
label: BODY

text: reference numbers linked to legislation (http://ec.europa.eu/enterprise/policies/european-
label: BODY

text: standards/documents/harmonised-standards-legislation/list-references/index_en.htm). National
label: BODY

text: technical Regulations are published on the Commission’s website
label: BODY

text: http://ec.europa.eu/enterprise/tris/index_en.htm to allow other countries and interested parties to
label: BODY

text: comment.
label: BODY

text: Member countries of the World Trade Organization (WTO) are required under the Agreement on
label: BODY

text: Technical Barriers to Trade (TBT) Agreement to report to the WTO all proposed technical
label: BODY

text: regulations that could affect trade with other member countries. Notify U.S. is a free, web-based
label: BODY

text: e-mail subscription service that offers an opportunity to review and comment on proposed
label: BODY

text: foreign technical regulations that can affect access to international markets. Register online at
label: BODY

text: Internet URL: http://tsapps.nist.gov/notifyus/data/index/index.cfm
label: BODY

text: Labeling and Marking
label: HH1

text: Manufacturers should be mindful that, in addition to the E.U.’s mandatory and voluntary
label: BODY

text: schemes, national voluntary labeling schemes might still apply. These schemes may be highly
label: BODY

text: appreciated by consumers, and thus, become unavoidable for marketing purposes.
label: BODY

text: Manufacturers are advised to take note that all labels require metric units although dual labeling
label: BODY

text: is also acceptable. The use of language on labels has been the subject of a Commission
label: BODY

text: Communication, which encourages multilingual information, while preserving the right of
label: BODY

text: Member States to require the use of language of the country of consumption.
label: BODY

text: The E.U. has mandated that certain products be sold in standardized quantities. Council
label: BODY

text: Directive 2007/45/EC, harmonizes packaging of wine and spirits throughout the E.U. Existing
label: BODY

text: national sizes will be abolished with a few exceptions for domestic producers.
label: BODY

text: Key Link: http://ec.europa.eu/enterprise/prepack/packsize/packsiz_en.htm
label: BODY

text: The Eco-label
label: BODY

text: The E.U. eco-label is a voluntary label which US exporters can display on products that meet
label: BODY

text: high standards of environmental awareness. The eco-label is intended to be a marketing tool to
label: BODY

text: encourage consumers to purchase environmentally-friendly products. The criteria for displaying
label: BODY

text: the eco-label are strict, covering the entire lifespan of the product from manufacture, to use, to
label: BODY

text: disposal. These criteria are reviewed every three to five years to take into account advances in
label: BODY

text: manufacturing procedures. There are currently twenty-three different product groups, and
label: BODY

text: approximately 250 licenses have been awarded for several hundred products.
label: BODY

text: INTERNATIONAL COPYRIGHT, U.S. & FOREIGN COMMERCIAL SERVICE AND U.S. DEPARTMENT OF STATE, 2008.
label: BODY

label: HH1

text: Excerpt from 2010 Country Commercial Guide
label: BODY

text: Applications to display the eco-label should be directed to the competency body of the member
label: BODY

text: state in which the product is sold. The application fee will be somewhere between €300 and
label: BODY

text: €1300 depending on the tests required to verify if the product is eligible. The eco-label also
label: BODY

text: carries an annual fee equal to 0.15 percent of the annual volume of sales of the product range
label: BODY

text: within the European community. However, the minimum annual fee is currently set at €500 and
label: BODY

text: maximum €25,000.
label: BODY

text: There are plans to significantly reform the eco-label in the near future, reducing the application
label: BODY

text: and annual fees and expanding the product ranges significantly. It is also possible that future
label: BODY

text: eligibility criteria may take into account carbon emissions.
label: BODY

text: Key Links: Eco-label Home Page
label: BODY
